Dear local newspaper, a recent survey conducted at @ORGANIZATION1 revealed that a significant number of students, @NUM1 out of @NUM2, spend a majority of their time on computers. This trend raises concerns about the impact of excessive computer usage on individuals, particularly in terms of safety, health, and education.  One of the primary concerns associated with increased computer usage is the potential for safety issues to arise. The anonymity of the internet can lead to encounters with dangerous individuals, putting users at risk of various threats such as fraud, harassment, and even physical harm. Furthermore, the lack of privacy controls on certain platforms can make personal information vulnerable to exploitation, highlighting the importance of exercising caution while navigating online spaces.  In addition to safety concerns, prolonged computer usage can have adverse effects on one's health. Many individuals, including a significant portion of teenagers, lead sedentary lifestyles due to excessive screen time, leading to a higher prevalence of obesity and related health issues. Moreover, extended exposure to screens can strain the eyes and contribute to headaches, emphasizing the importance of taking regular breaks and practicing proper eye care habits.  Furthermore, the impact of computers on education is a growing concern, as students may become easily distracted by the multitude of entertainment options available online, leading to neglect of academic responsibilities. This distraction can result in poor academic performance, as students may prioritize computer activities over essential tasks such as homework and studying for exams.  It is crucial for individuals to recognize the negative effects of excessive computer usage and take proactive measures to mitigate these risks. Balancing screen time with physical activity, implementing privacy settings, and establishing boundaries for educational purposes can help promote a healthier relationship with technology.  In conclusion, while computers offer numerous benefits and conveniences, it is essential to be mindful of the potential drawbacks associated with their excessive use. By fostering awareness and adopting responsible habits, individuals can harness the power of technology without compromising their safety, health, or educational pursuits. Let us strive to find a balance that allows us to enjoy the benefits of computers while safeguarding our well-being and overall quality of life.

Dear Local Newspaper, back a couple decades ago, before computers existed, children were outside exercising, playing with friends, and living somewhat danger-free lives. Then came the computer. It is so easy to come across things that should not be seen while surfing the web! These unfortunate factors cause many of the issues between people today. Computers have a very negative effect on relationships nowadays. So many fights happen through computer communications. Even if online conversations are friendly, they get people accustomed to making people "keyboard warriors" through a computer, not face to face. After being in a computer-oriented friendship, people tend to forget how to act face to face and find personal meetings awkward. "I can't imagine only talking through computers, never being civilized with other human beings! Unfortunately, that is where computers are leading us to..." said an eighth grader at a local school. Spending all day in front of a computer, putting yourself and relationships in danger is, unfortunately, the effect of computers. Make the change today and stop the advances in technology before it is too late. Let's not lose our humanity to the screens.

Dear Local Newspaper,  Computers have undeniably made a positive impact on society in various ways. One of the significant benefits they offer is assisting individuals in writing papers. With just a few clicks, users can find the latest articles and resources on any topic, eliminating the need to spend hours in libraries searching for relevant material. This ease of access not only saves time but also enables individuals to delve deeper into their research and make more informed decisions.  In conclusion, computers have had a positive impact on society by aiding in paper writing, serving as social tools for communication and connection, and streamlining the research process. Dear Newspaper, @CAPS1 technology has grown exponentially in recent years, with the use of computers skyrocketing. However, this trend is not necessarily something to celebrate. In conclusion, while computers have undoubtedly brought numerous benefits, it is essential to recognize the potential drawbacks associated with their overuse. By limiting screen time and prioritizing real-life experiences, individuals can safeguard their health, relationships, and connection to the natural world. Let us remember to unplug and step outside to truly appreciate the wonders that surround us.

It is important for individuals to balance computer use with physical activity to maintain a healthy lifestyle.  In conclusion, while computers offer numerous benefits in terms of communication and productivity, it is crucial to be mindful of the potential negative effects of excessive use. Finding a balance between utilizing technology for its advantages and prioritizing physical well-being is key to leading a healthy and fulfilling life. Let's embrace the benefits of computers while also taking care of our health and well-being.

Dear Parents,  Are you always telling your kids to do their homework and get off the computer? Well, I might just be able to help. Computers do not benefit our society today. People are spending too much time on them, not enjoying the outdoors, and taking away time to spend with friends and family. I believe having a limit each day on your computer might help solve these problems. Computers can be very distracting and you can use them too often. Staring at the computer screen can damage your eyes and kill brain cells. That's one thing kids and adults don't notice. You need your brain cells for school, jobs, and other activities; computers can also distract you from completing work, and then you have to stay up late to finish homework. Schoolwork should come before the computer. Time flies by as you're clicking and typing. The next thing you know, it's ten o'clock and your work is not completed. Since my schedule is so busy after school, I try to complete my work, then go to the computer before dance. This way, I am with my friends and can relax. Taking time away from the computer is a smart idea.  As it comes to summer time, the weather is going to be beautiful, and you don't want to waste a pretty day on the computer. Our human body needs oxygen. Clearly, computers don't supply that. A great way to receive oxygen is going outside for some exercise and energy. Playing outside can offer a lot more than a computer. You can swim, jump, or play sports. My doctor once told me, "Everyone should have at least an hour of exercise a day." You can't accomplish that by sitting at your computer. Next time there is sunshine out, no matter what season it is, go outside and take a break from electronics.  Spending time with family and friends is a fun way to stay off the computer. Friends and family are not people to take advantage of. They are people who are there for you when you are down and make you laugh. When your relatives come to town that you haven't seen in a while, you don't want to spend it on the computer. Talking and catching up with one another is a great way to re-connect. During family holidays, we don't bring our computers. We shut them off to spend time with each other. Friends and family are special gifts. So, don't throw away friendships or relationships with your family. Get away from the computer and bond.  Remember, balance is key. Limit your time on the computer, enjoy the outdoors, and make time for family and friends. Your overall well-being will thank you for it.

In conclusion, computers have a significant positive impact on people and should continue to be an integral part of everyday society.

In conclusion, it is imperative for individuals to limit their screen time and prioritize spending quality time with their families outdoors. By striking a healthy balance between digital and real-life activities, we can protect our mental and physical health, strengthen relationships, and ultimately avoid the negative consequences associated with excessive computer use. Let's take the initiative to disconnect from our devices and embrace the beauty of the world around us.

To the Middlebury paper, regarding the article on whether or not computers benefit society, I believe that computers bring numerous advantages that make them essential in schools, homes, and businesses. They play a crucial role in our daily lives, aiding us in staying connected and informed. In schools, computers enhance learning by providing online resources for various subjects, such as math and health. They also help in saving costs by offering virtual learning opportunities, eliminating the need for expensive field trips. Additionally, computer games can improve hand-eye coordination, a skill vital for children's development. The educational benefits of computers will continue to grow with advancing technology, making it unwise to restrict children's access to them.   Moreover, computers facilitate communication, allowing students to receive assignments and interact with teachers through email. This efficient communication saves time and enhances productivity. Cost-effectiveness is another advantage, as using computers for communication reduces expenses on phone bills and tutoring services. Furthermore, computers simplify staying in touch with family members, enabling quick and easy communication with multiple relatives through a single email. Speeding up communication through computers undeniably offers benefits that should not be overlooked.   It is important to note that blaming computers for the lack of exercise is unjust, as individuals have the autonomy to choose how they allocate their time, whether it be for physical activity or screen time. Ultimately, the responsibility lies with the user, not the computer, in determining the extent of computer usage. Therefore, maintaining the current level of computer usage is crucial for sustaining communication, education, and overall societal advancement. When used judiciously, computers can greatly contribute to society by enhancing connectivity and knowledge-sharing.

Dear @ORGANIZATION3, @CAPS1 has come to @CAPS2 attention that certain members of our society believe that computers are not beneficial. This position comes from lack judgment and a closed mind. Computers are lifelines to business workers who use them to complete all of their work. These tools also enable news of disasters or weather to spread efficiently and effectively. These technological devices also create and sustain communication between family members and friends. In today's society, computers are vital, and getting rid of them would be like stopping oxygen from making its way to the body, accompanied by multiple severe consequences.   First and foremost, about 90% of all modern companies require their employees to work on computers. These works of art aren't just handy-dandy toys, but are essential to the working class - a pencil to a student taking a test. @PERSON3, an owner of a small business, agrees. "@CAPS2 company designs software and uses computers extensively. Many of @CAPS2 employees work from home and have to own computers." The growth of computers is not something to be frowned upon, but an achievement in technology enhancing the lives of others. By ripping computers from the lives of workers, chaos would be created with many unappealing consequences.   Adults aren't the only ones whose jobs consist of computers. Nowadays, students' homework is mostly online. Computers decrease the amount of time needed to write an essay and are a glare to students of all ages. @PERSON4, an eighth-grader at @ORGANIZATION1, is an example of this dilemma. Every night she has at least three hours of homework, and usually one hour requires a computer. However, this isn't a problem because it cuts back the time it takes for @PERSON4 to do her homework. She can quickly type up an essay or research a science topic instead of doing it painstakingly slow using an old-fashioned method.   Moreover, computers are doors into the real world, especially for residents of secluded areas like @LOCATION1. Whether some people like to believe it or not, @LOCATION1 is a bit of a secluded area where people aren't aware of what is going on outside of their closed-off town. Computers cause news to spread like electricity and open residents' eyes to national and global problems. @PERSON2, another student at @ORGANIZATION5, states, "When the earthquake took place in @LOCATION3, my friends and I were all at lunch, and we came back to class, our teacher was projecting the news via her computer onto the whiteboard." If computers were taken away, a stream of knowledge would be cut off from adults and children.   Most importantly, computers create communication between friends and family. Calling up to talk to someone isn't always an option, so computers are the better choice. Families can connect with each other no matter if they have cell phone reception or what area of the world they are in. @PERSON1, a senior at @LOCATION1 and @ORGANIZATION1, who agrees. "@CAPS4 I go to college next year, I am going all the way to @LOCATION2 and want to be able to talk to my family, via email and instant message I can contact them even if it's inconvenient because they don't have to respond right away." @PERSON1 brings up a good point - computers serve the luxury of communication, which is vital to keep healthy relationships, as shown in a study at @ORGANIZATION4.   In conclusion, computers are an incredible piece of equipment that should be valued and not taken away. They are vital to workers and students and bring news to residents of any corner of the world. Computers also are how friends and family are able to stay connected and communicate. Therefore, I urge you, readers of the @ORGANIZATION2, to raise your voice about the benefits of computers, so they aren't taken away from our society.

@ORGANIZATION1, @CAPS1? Are you there?" "@CAPS2 you hear me?" You never have that issue with computers. It has come to my understanding that there is a dispute about the benefits of computers - should we have them and advance them, or not? Well, I believe that computers are a necessity for an average person. Computers help everyone, and make life easier! Sure, there are cellphones and other helpful electronics, but are they always as trustworthy as computers? Computers are always reliable - whether it's for homework or another reason! Computers provide easy interaction without breakups, they make it easier to learn, and if you are smart, then they are safe. Without computers, who knows where our society would be? To begin, computers allow people to have conversations with others... that are halfway across the world! There are a variety of applications that you can choose from, and they are all easy to use. My personally preferred option is email. I myself have family in another continent, which is a whole continent away! Sure, I could call them, but my phone bill would be through the roof! How else am I supposed to keep intact with my loved ones? Do you know how many others face the same problem? Through a recent study, a large percentage of families in a particular location say they have relatives that are far away. That is a significant portion of the population! Imagine there was no computer for them to use. Phone companies would be in money and regular families would be living on the streets. Or worse - they would lose any relationship with their family. Do you want that? Computers are easy to access, and you can interact with loved ones, friends, or new people. It doesn't get any better than that! So, which would you choose - losing your family relations or keeping in touch via email and computer applications? If that isn't enough, computers make it easy to learn new things and accomplish tasks. I know that as a student, other students and I need to type our homework at least three times a week! Just yesterday I had to type up a response, a free writing choice, and an entry for a history project. Imagine if we had to go back to using typewriters. Either homework wouldn't be done or everyone would have a major lack of sleep. Both options are unacceptable. Plus, computers are great for research. If you have to look up a new country, look at far away colleges, or find out about the world, why not visit your handy computer? You could learn which college is right for you without leaving your house. You could visit a new country without leaving town! Sure, you could read a newspaper, but answer me this - where does the paper come from? Yup, trees are killed for them. Computers are the easy, environment-friendly alternative for you. If those two reasons didn't convince you, maybe this one will. Most people think computers are unsafe, and that may be partly true. But if you are smart or listen in school like me, you will know that isn't always the case. In our school, we are taught about the risks of computers, and how to prevent any possible issues. I'm sure most schools do. In fact, nine out of ten students say that when it comes to safety, computers are rated an A+. Everyone knows about hackers, and so we avoid them. My parents even say that for over thirty years they have never had a single issue or risk of safety when using a computer, and neither have I. "Issues are only powerful if you let them be, and let them take control," says an expert on the subject. So, if it's safety you are worried about, then don't. The kids of today, and tomorrow, know what is out there, and how to stop the minor issues. So, why don't we recap what we learned today. Are computers helpful and the best way to go for communication? Yes, they are. What is the best way to learn new things easily? I believe the correct answer is computers. What are safe even if some don't agree. It wasn't phones... no, not television... oh yes, computers! I see why you might think no, they should be outside, well let me tell you, cellphones and t.v. will keep them from that anyway. At least computers don't rot your brain. Well, I have done my part. I support computers, and their advancement. But it isn't up to me, is it? No, it's not. So please do your part by spreading the word. It's the right thing to do. You know that you want to! And remember, computers are here to stay and make our lives better in countless ways.

Dear Local Community,  Did you know that spending too much time on technology could increase the risk of cancer? As technology continues to advance, people, especially children, are becoming more immersed in it, often neglecting the potential negative impacts on their physical and mental health. The obesity rate in our community is at an all-time high, with many individuals unaware that technology plays a significant role in this issue. For example, the average teenager spends hours on the computer each day, leading to a sedentary lifestyle and increased risk of obesity and diabetes.  Limiting computer use to one hour a day and incorporating regular exercise can significantly improve overall health and well-being. Not only will you have more energy and mental focus, but you will also reduce the risk of developing various health conditions associated with excessive technology use. Additionally, excessive screen time can lead to social isolation and cyberbullying, affecting relationships and mental health.  Furthermore, some forms of cancer can be linked to the radiation emitted by technological devices, highlighting the importance of moderation in technology use. It's crucial to be mindful of the impact of technology on our health, social interactions, and mental well-being. By reducing screen time, staying active, and prioritizing face-to-face interactions, we can safeguard our health and improve our overall quality of life.  Let's make a conscious effort to limit our reliance on technology and prioritize our health and well-being. Together, we can create a healthier and more connected community.  Sincerely,  [Your Name]

Dear people, Computers have been here for not a very long time and everyday more people buy computers and everyday people use them. As they are used for entertainment, education, and talking with people far away, they have had a negative effect on people. Let me explain. First of all, as people use computers in the beginning they enjoy it. They go on the internet, play games, and use it for work. But as they keep using it, they start to get addicted. People are addicted to computers because of the games and being able to go on the internet. In fact, a high percentage of all the people in this country who own a computer are addicted to computers. That percentage is expected to grow in the next few years. Addiction to computers can lead to serious issues. People have died because they spent too much time on the computer without eating and sleeping. In another incident not long ago, it was reported that a student attending a prestigious university was dropped out for doing poorly in school. His parents found out that he was addicted to a particular game. This game is currently the most played game on the internet in this country. Studies show that computer addiction is almost as bad as smoking addiction.   My second reason why computers have a negative effect on people is because of online bullying. People chat on social media, forums, and email and people are bullied. A friend of mine recently was emailed with words that hurt his feelings. Online bullying is worse than in-person bullying because when you say something on the internet, people don't know who you are. A professor who recently studied online bullying says, "Online bullying has become more severe than in-person bullying. People are threatened more and hear more hurtful words online." Online bullying and harassment will continue to worsen if people don't stop. People can also face legal consequences for what they write online.   My final reason why computers have a negative effect on people is that people spend too much time on computers and don't exercise. Computers contribute to overweight issues. On the computer, everything is much easier. Instead of mailing, you can email. You can listen to music instead of walking up to the radio and turning it on. You can buy tickets, shop, talk with friends, and have fun just by sitting at a computer. But this is why people become overweight and obese. A significant percentage of people who use computers are obese or overweight. People spend less time interacting with friends and family and enjoying nature.   In conclusion, computers have a negative effect on people and parents should control their child's time on the computers. Many issues arise because of computer usage. If you think you are addicted, try to make a time schedule for your day. Use the computer for an hour at a time and take breaks before using it again. Addiction, online bullying, and becoming overweight are not the only problems associated with computer usage; there are many more.

Dear newspaper, it is evident that the use of computers is becoming increasingly popular among people, and this trend is indeed commendable. The ability to communicate with others online, learn about distant places and individuals, and improve hand-eye coordination are just a few of the many benefits that computers offer to society.   One significant advantage of using computers is the opportunity they provide for individuals to stay connected with their loved ones, regardless of geographical distance. For instance, people can communicate with family members who are far away through online platforms, fostering relationships and maintaining strong bonds. This aspect of computer usage is especially valuable in today's fast-paced world, where physical distance can often hinder communication.  Moreover, computers play a crucial role in enhancing hand-eye coordination, as demonstrated by the example of an elderly individual who has developed impressive coordination skills through computer use. This improvement in coordination can have a positive impact on various daily activities, highlighting the practical benefits of incorporating technology into one's routine.  Additionally, computers serve as powerful tools for expanding knowledge and accessing information about diverse subjects. Whether it is researching a specific topic for a project or exploring different cultures and locations, the internet offers a wealth of resources that can broaden one's understanding of the world. This aspect of computer usage not only facilitates learning but also stimulates intellectual growth and curiosity.  In conclusion, the widespread adoption of computers is undeniably beneficial for society, offering numerous advantages that contribute to personal growth, communication, and knowledge acquisition. By embracing technology and harnessing its potential, individuals can enhance their lives and connect with others in meaningful ways. The positive impact of computers on society is undeniable, making them an indispensable part of modern living.

I agree that computers have a negative impact on people because they lead to a decrease in physical activity, which can result in lethargy and a lack of fitness. Additionally, excessive computer use can hinder cognitive abilities and memory retention, leading to difficulties in learning and focusing. Furthermore, spending too much time on the computer can isolate individuals from their loved ones, causing them to miss out on valuable time with family and friends. In conclusion, it is important to strike a balance between computer use and other activities to maintain a healthy lifestyle and strong relationships.

Dear @CAPS1, @CAPS2 as a student, I believe that computers have many negative effects on people. While they are undoubtedly useful for school research and work, there are also numerous drawbacks to excessive computer use.   One major concern is the amount of time kids spend on computers, which can lead to neglect of important tasks like homework and projects. Additionally, children are increasingly meeting strangers online through social networks, which can be dangerous if they decide to meet in person. This exposure to unknown individuals poses a significant risk to their safety.  Moreover, unrestricted internet access allows young people to view harmful and inappropriate content, impacting their mental and emotional well-being. The sedentary lifestyle associated with prolonged computer use can also lead to health issues such as weight gain and lack of physical fitness.  Furthermore, excessive computer use can result in social isolation as individuals spend less time engaging in real-life activities and relationships. Keeping computers out of kids' bedrooms can help prevent them from staying up late and disrupting their sleep schedule.  In order to mitigate these negative effects, it is essential for individuals to establish a balanced schedule for computer use. By setting limits and prioritizing other activities such as exercise, socializing, and family time, people can maintain a healthy lifestyle while still benefiting from the advantages of technology. It is crucial to recognize the potential drawbacks of excessive computer use and take proactive steps to address them for a well-rounded and fulfilling life.

I believe that people spending too much time on computers can affect their health and relationships with friends and family. When immersed in computer activities, individuals may prioritize screen time over social interactions, leading to strained relationships. Choosing to stay indoors on the computer rather than engaging in outdoor activities with friends can create distance and hinder bonding. Similarly, opting to remain online instead of participating in family gatherings or events can weaken family connections. Moreover, excessive computer use can impact physical health by replacing time that could be spent exercising. Sedentary behavior due to prolonged computer use can contribute to weight gain and health issues. Additionally, excessive screen time can disrupt sleep patterns, leading to fatigue and difficulty concentrating on daily tasks such as school or work. Overall, it is important to strike a balance between computer use and real-life interactions to maintain healthy relationships and well-being.

Dear Local Newspaper,   Computers have become an integral part of society, benefiting people all over the world by making them smarter and more advanced. With the ability to access vast amounts of information, stay connected with loved ones, and even develop new theories, computers have truly revolutionized the way we live our lives.   One of the most significant advantages of computers is their role in education. Through various websites and online tools, people can easily access information that helps them learn and grow. For example, search engines and dictionaries enable users to explore a wealth of knowledge at their fingertips. This accessibility to information has allowed us to advance in many aspects of our lives.  Additionally, computers provide a means for people to stay connected with family and friends, no matter where they are in the world. Social media platforms like Facebook and MySpace have made it easier than ever to maintain relationships and keep in touch with loved ones. Many people, like myself, have found that these platforms are a great way to stay connected with friends from the past.  While it is true that computers can be addictive, it ultimately comes down to personal responsibility. If individuals are able to make wise decisions about their computer usage, then there is no harm in spending time in front of a screen. It is important to recognize the benefits that computers bring to our lives and use them in a way that enhances our overall well-being.  In conclusion, computers have had a positive impact on society, helping us learn, communicate, and innovate. While there may be concerns about addiction, when used responsibly, computers are a valuable tool that enriches our lives. Let us continue to embrace the benefits of technology and harness its power for the betterment of ourselves and our communities.   Sincerely,  [Your Name]

Dear local newspaper,   Computers are often seen as a valuable tool in today's society, but some believe they are simply a waste of time. While it is true that computers can be a source of distraction and can lead to sedentary lifestyles, it is important to consider the benefits they provide as well.   One argument against computers is that they hinder face-to-face communication and can be a breeding ground for misinformation. However, it is also important to acknowledge that computers have revolutionized the way we connect with others, especially during times when physical interaction may not be possible.   Furthermore, the accessibility to vast amounts of information through the internet can be invaluable for research purposes. While it is true that not all information online may be accurate, the same can be said for printed materials. It is ultimately up to the individual to discern reliable sources from unreliable ones.   In terms of physical health, it is crucial for individuals to balance their computer usage with physical activity. Encouraging children to engage in outdoor activities is essential for their overall well-being.   While it is important to be mindful of the potential negative impacts of excessive computer use, it is also crucial to recognize the many advantages that computers offer in terms of communication, research, and productivity. Finding a balance between technology and real-world interactions is key to a healthy and fulfilling lifestyle.   In conclusion, while it is easy to dismiss computers as a waste of time, it is important to consider the ways in which they have enhanced our lives. By being conscious of how we use technology and incorporating physical activity into our daily routines, we can enjoy the benefits of computers while maintaining a healthy lifestyle.

Dear Newspaper Editors,  In today's age, the debate surrounding the effects of computers on individuals, particularly children, is gaining momentum. While some argue that computers have positive effects, I firmly believe that they have detrimental impacts. One major concern is the amount of time people, especially children, spend on computers rather than engaging in physical activities. This sedentary behavior contributes to a lack of exercise, leading to various health issues like obesity. It is essential for individuals to prioritize physical activity over screen time.  Furthermore, proponents of computer use often highlight the hand-eye coordination it can improve. However, sports and outdoor activities also offer opportunities to enhance this skill while promoting overall physical health. By choosing outdoor activities over screen time, individuals can develop hand-eye coordination in a more holistic and beneficial manner.  Lastly, the argument that computers aid in learning about distant places and people overlooks the fact that books provide a similar, if not more reliable, source of information. Books offer a tangible and credible way to explore different cultures and regions without the risk of misinformation that can be found online. Relying on books for knowledge ensures accuracy and depth of understanding.  In conclusion, computers may have their uses, but the negative effects of excessive screen time cannot be ignored. It is crucial for individuals, especially children, to prioritize physical activity, seek alternative ways to improve skills like hand-eye coordination, and utilize reliable sources like books for knowledge. Let us encourage a balanced approach to technology use for a healthier and more enriching lifestyle.  Sincerely,  [Your Name]

Dear Local Newspaper,   Encouraging people to spend more time outdoors with their family and friends is a great way to promote a healthier lifestyle. Computers play a crucial role in modern society, offering a multitude of benefits to individuals. Through the use of computers, people can easily access a wealth of information on various topics. Dear local newspaper, it has been brought to my attention that too many people in our community are spending excessive amounts of time indoors on their computers, rather than enjoying the beautiful weather outside. This trend is having negative effects on the physical, mental, and social well-being of our population.  One concerning issue is the high rate of obesity among children in our area, which can be attributed to the sedentary lifestyle associated with excessive computer use. Instead of engaging in physical activities that promote health and fitness, children are spending hours in front of screens, leading to weight gain and related health problems.  Furthermore, prolonged exposure to computer screens can have detrimental effects on brain health, including an increased risk of seizures and potential radiation exposure. The impact on memory and cognitive function is also a concern, as excessive computer use has been linked to memory loss and difficulty retaining information learned in school.  In addition to the physical and mental health implications, excessive computer use can also lead to social isolation. While others are out enjoying social activities, individuals glued to their screens may find themselves lacking meaningful social connections and interactions.  It is crucial for individuals to consider the long-term consequences of their computer usage and make a conscious effort to balance screen time with activities that promote physical activity, mental stimulation, and social engagement. Making healthier choices today can lead to a happier and more fulfilling life in the future.  Let us all take a moment to reflect on our screen time habits and strive to find a better balance that prioritizes our overall well-being. It is never too late to make positive changes and reap the benefits of a more balanced lifestyle.

Dear editor, Computers are becoming more prevalent in society, leading to people spending excessive amounts of time on them. This trend has detrimental effects on individuals and communities, as it results in decreased physical activity, limited exposure to the world, and a lack of social interaction. It is crucial for individuals to use computers in moderation and prioritize other important aspects of life.  One significant consequence of excessive computer use is the decline in physical activity among users. Research shows that computer users engage in significantly less exercise compared to non-computer users. This sedentary lifestyle can lead to various health issues, such as obesity and lethargy. Encouraging people to step away from their screens and prioritize physical activity is essential for promoting a healthier and more active society.  Furthermore, excessive computer use can prevent individuals from fully experiencing the world around them. While the internet may provide information about different cultures and places, nothing can replace the richness of firsthand experiences. Traveling to new and unfamiliar destinations allows people to immerse themselves in diverse cultures and environments, fostering a deeper understanding and appreciation of the world. It is essential for individuals to step away from their computers and explore the wonders of the world firsthand.  Lastly, excessive computer use can hinder social interaction with family and friends. Spending too much time on screens can lead to neglecting personal relationships and missing out on valuable moments with loved ones. Meaningful interactions with others are essential for emotional well-being and overall happiness. It is important for individuals to prioritize face-to-face communication and quality time with family and friends.  In conclusion, while computers have become integral to modern life, it is crucial for individuals to use them in moderation. Excessive computer use can have negative consequences on physical health, cultural experiences, and social relationships. By striking a balance and prioritizing other aspects of life, individuals can lead healthier, more fulfilling lives.

Dear editor, Have you ever used a computer? Odds are you have, which means you know how convenient and positive computers are. Did you know that 90% of all individuals use computers regularly? These have been many advancements in computer technology, with some people supporting them and others opposing them. Dear editor: Did you know that 80% of people in the United States have computers? These computers are definitely benefiting society. People need computers to stay updated on important issues, contact others, and learn new information. Computers have become essential in our everyday lives. It is crucial for news to spread quickly, and computers play a key role in achieving this. Average individuals like you and me need to stay informed about the weather, global events, and various other significant topics. By using a computer to access this information, we can stay informed immediately. For instance, instead of waiting for the weather forecast on television, we can find out the weather in our local area within seconds. In times of natural disasters like the recent earthquake in Japan where millions lost their lives, it is vital for people to be informed, and computers provide a reliable means for updates. Not only do computers help us receive important global updates, but they also serve as a great tool for contacting others. Personally, I use email to communicate with relatives who live far away, as long-distance phone calls can be expensive. Statistics show that 70% of people contact distant friends and family through email. Additionally, social networking sites like Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram offer a platform for friends to connect with each other. Human interaction is essential, and the internet provides a convenient way to achieve this. Furthermore, computers are valuable for acquiring new knowledge. Children can easily find information for school projects or essays by conducting online searches. Adults can also benefit from computers when seeking to learn something new. It is much simpler to search for information online rather than going to a library to find a book. Did you know that most adults use an online dictionary to look up word definitions? Computers provide answers to all our questions. In conclusion, computers are truly benefiting society by keeping us informed on important issues, facilitating communication, and aiding in the acquisition of new information. These technological advancements are enhancing human society in significant ways.

Dear Local Newspaper, having a home computer has numerous benefits. One key advantage is the ability to access information about different countries and cultures, enhancing our knowledge and understanding of the world. Additionally, computers help save paper by allowing us to type and store documents digitally, reducing our reliance on physical copies. Having a computer at home can have its drawbacks, especially when it comes to children. One of the main concerns is the potential for addiction. Children can become so engrossed in games or online activities that they have a hard time disconnecting, leading to arguments and tantrums when it's time to turn off the computer. This can create a cycle of dependence that is difficult to break.  Furthermore, the internet can be a dangerous place for young minds. Inappropriate content such as explicit images or videos can easily be accessed, leading to premature exposure to adult themes. Parents may struggle to monitor and control their child's online activities, increasing the risk of encountering harmful content.  Lastly, the financial aspect of owning a computer cannot be overlooked. Repairs, upgrades, and purchasing new software can quickly add up, putting a strain on the family budget. In addition, children may inadvertently damage the computer, leading to costly repairs or replacements.  While computers offer convenience and entertainment, it is essential to weigh the potential risks and drawbacks, especially when it comes to children. It is crucial for parents to set boundaries, monitor usage, and educate their children about safe internet practices to mitigate these challenges.

It is essential to remember the value of outdoor activities, reading, and other forms of entertainment that do not involve screens. Finding a balance between technology and other activities is key to leading a well-rounded and fulfilling life.  In conclusion, while computers offer numerous benefits, it is essential to use them in moderation. Finding a healthy balance between screen time and other activities will help us lead a more balanced and enjoyable life.

Do you like computers? Do you use the internet to help you? Do you use it every day? Well, this article gives you information about all of this. First, a lot of people don't like computers because they say they're too confusing. Actually, computers aren't that hard to work; you just have to be patient and take some time to get used to it. Also, computers can make things easier, like typing. Why should you write by hand when you have the option to use a computer, which lets you write faster than you could on normal paper?  Secondly, the internet is much easier than books. All you have to do is go to Google or any other search engine, type what you're looking for, and in a split second, you have all the information in the world on that topic. Also, if you're planning a vacation, the internet can help. You can purchase plane tickets online, and sometimes there are special discounts available on the web. You can also book hotels and look at live pictures to ensure you have a good vacation.  Finally, you can purchase anything with a click of a button. Almost every website offers discounts. I remember the time when I bought a pair of shoes online for a great price. It usually ships to your house in a couple of days. Going on the computer a lot isn't bad. I go on the computer almost every day but also go outside too. I can do this because at night when no one can go outside, I go on the computer for school or for fun. You can also talk to your friends or family over the internet. If your mom or dad went on a weeks-long business trip, you could use your webcam and talk to them and see them as if you were in the same room. So, is going on the computer really so bad? I don't think so; it is helpful and easy to work with.

Dear newspaper company,  More and more people are using computers every day, sparking a debate about whether they truly benefit society. While some argue that excessive computer use leads to a lack of physical activity and can strain the eyes, I believe that the advantages of computers far outweigh the drawbacks.  One of the main benefits of computers is their ability to improve hand-eye coordination and provide access to information from around the world. Through computers, people can book hotels, watch movies, play games, and even communicate with individuals from different countries. In addition, computers play a crucial role in solving crimes by enabling law enforcement to track criminals and their records.  Despite these benefits, there are also negative aspects associated with computer use. Cyberbullying is a significant issue, with individuals being targeted and harassed online. Plagiarism is another concern, as some people may take credit for work that is not their own. Furthermore, the illegal downloading of music through platforms like LimeWire deprives artists of their rightful earnings.  In conclusion, while computers offer numerous advantages, it is essential to be cautious of the potential negative consequences they can bring. By using computers responsibly and ethically, we can harness their benefits while minimizing their drawbacks.  Sincerely, [Your Name]

Dear all computer lovers, I do believe that spending too much time on the computer can be detrimental to your overall well-being. While it is important to utilize the computer for learning and entertainment, it is equally important to engage in activities that promote physical and mental health.  One such activity is enjoying nature. Spending time outdoors can provide a much-needed break from the digital world and allow you to appreciate the beauty of the natural environment. Whether it's taking a walk in the park, hiking in the mountains, or simply sitting outside and breathing in the fresh air, connecting with nature can be a rejuvenating experience.  Furthermore, spending quality time with family and friends is essential for building strong relationships and creating lasting memories. Family gatherings, parties, and outings with friends can bring joy, laughter, and a sense of belonging that cannot be replicated online. These interpersonal connections are vital for emotional well-being and overall happiness.  Lastly, incorporating regular exercise into your routine is crucial for maintaining physical health and mental clarity. Whether it's going for a run, practicing yoga, or playing a sport, physical activity is essential for staying fit, reducing stress, and improving overall quality of life.  In conclusion, while the computer is a valuable tool, it is important to balance screen time with activities that promote physical activity, social connections, and a connection with nature. By finding a healthy balance between technology and real-life experiences, you can lead a more fulfilling and well-rounded life.

There are all kinds of computers, but they all serve the same purpose - to assist people in various tasks. Computers offer a wide range of benefits, from facilitating online communication and shopping to providing access to educational resources and aiding in homework completion. The convenience of online college courses allows individuals with busy schedules to further their education. Additionally, connecting with friends through online platforms offers a convenient way to stay in touch when in-person meetings are not possible. The vast amount of information available on the internet makes learning about different topics and cultures easily accessible to anyone. Whether it's buying and selling goods, completing homework assignments, or simply enjoying a computer game, computers cater to the diverse needs and interests of people worldwide. In essence, computers have become an indispensable tool that enhances various aspects of our lives.

To whom it may concern,   My name is @PERSON1. I have written in response to the letter sent to me on the topic of electronics, specifically computers. Computers, in my opinion, have both positive and negative aspects. While they can be helpful, I find them to be extremely problematic.   One of the main issues I have with computers is their cost. Companies like Dell and others sell computers at high prices, and even when purchased on sale, they often come with malfunctions and problems that require expensive repairs. This cycle of spending money on faulty technology is frustrating and unsustainable.   Furthermore, prolonged use of computers can have negative effects on health. Staring at a screen for extended periods can lead to eye strain and other health problems. Instead of sitting in front of a computer, it is important to stay active and engage in physical activities for overall well-being.   Lastly, I believe that excessive reliance on computers can hinder learning and critical thinking skills. Using computers to find easy answers to homework assignments can prevent students from truly understanding and retaining information. This could potentially lead to a generation of individuals who struggle to think for themselves.   In conclusion, while computers have their benefits, the drawbacks such as high costs, health implications, and negative impact on learning should not be ignored. It is essential to find a balance and not let technology dictate our lives. Thank you for considering my perspective on this matter.  Sincerely, @PERSON1

Dear @CAPS1 @CAPS2, I believe that excessive computer use can have negative consequences. People may neglect their homework and become addicted to computers, leading to potential dangers. Engaging with strangers online can be risky, akin to having a MySpace account where malicious individuals may lurk. Caution is vital as some people use computers to spread harmful content. It's crucial to be mindful of the risks and prioritize safety when using computers.

I do not agree that computers benefit society. There are three big reasons why computers are bad for society. Firstly, people are getting too attached to their computers and are neglecting spending time with their families. This can lead to isolation and strained relationships within the family unit. Additionally, excessive computer use can contribute to health issues such as weight gain and a lack of physical activity. People who spend too much time on computers may not prioritize exercise and outdoor activities, leading to a sedentary lifestyle that can result in various health problems. Moreover, prolonged computer use can have negative effects on mental health, as individuals may become addicted to computer games and experience feelings of loneliness and depression. It is important for individuals to strike a balance between computer use and real-world interactions to maintain overall well-being. In conclusion, while computers have their benefits, it is essential to be mindful of the potential negative impacts they can have on individuals and society as a whole. Finding a healthy balance in computer use is key to ensuring a positive impact on society.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, In the @DATE1, the world has changed dramatically for the better. Technological advancements have revolutionized the way we live, with computers playing a crucial role in enhancing communication. The ability to connect with family members, friends, and even strangers from different parts of the world has become much easier and more convenient thanks to the internet. As the saying goes, "communication is key," and computers have truly unlocked a world of possibilities in this regard.  Gone are the days when communication was limited to letters or face-to-face interactions. With the click of a button, we can now send emails or instant messages to anyone, anywhere, at any time. This instantaneous form of communication not only bridges the gap between people but also allows for quicker and more efficient exchange of information. The days of waiting for a letter to arrive or hoping someone answers the phone are long gone, replaced by the convenience of digital communication.  Moreover, computers have the power to reconnect us with long-lost family members and friends. Through social networking sites and online platforms, we can easily locate and reach out to loved ones we may have lost touch with over the years. This ability to reconnect with our past and strengthen relationships that may have faded over time is truly invaluable, and computers have made it all possible with just a few clicks.  Additionally, the internet opens up a whole new world of opportunities to meet and connect with people from diverse backgrounds and cultures. By engaging with individuals who may live in different states or countries, we not only broaden our horizons but also gain valuable insights into different perspectives and ways of life. The world wide web serves as a platform for cultural exchange and mutual understanding, fostering connections that transcend geographical boundaries.  In conclusion, the advent of computers and the internet has revolutionized the way we communicate, allowing us to connect with others more efficiently and effectively. Whether it's rekindling old friendships, forging new connections, or learning about different cultures, computers have become essential tools for enhancing human interaction in today's interconnected world. Embracing technology and utilizing it to its full potential can truly enrich our lives and bring us closer together as a global community.

Dear @CAPS1, @CAPS2, computers have become an integral part of our society, offering numerous benefits to individuals of all ages. Both children and adults can benefit from using computers for entertainment, learning, and work purposes. In conclusion, computers have revolutionized the way we learn, communicate, and work, making them invaluable tools for personal and professional growth. Dear readers, On the current debate of the effects of computers, I believe they strongly benefit all people. For example, on some computers, a business software can be incorporated, allowing a meeting to be held over the computers. Not only is it convenient, but this saves money. Also, computers come with built-in programs that can help keep track of your expenses. These are simple and save lots of time. Plus, computers also help you stay in touch with friends. Even if they are miles away, you can click a button and have a live video chat!  First off, the business software on new computers is out of this world. You can make a brochure of sales and expenses, all with an easy stroke on the mouse. This is a cheaper and greener way of presenting ideas. Furthermore, on the computer, you and all your clients can hold a conference call. Doing this allows you to relax and multitask while your computer is feeding you coverage of the call in crystal-clear sound. Normally a phone would have to be glued to your ear, but now you are hands-free.  Another time where computers are handy is at tax time. Tired of running around your house to find your car bill from three months ago? Well, with a spreadsheet software like Excel, taxes can be calculated along with their name, so when you take the taxes to a tax consultant, everything is organized. Using these tools cuts down on stress and leaves you less frustrated. And even better, you can buy a tax program for your computer, so you never have to leave your couch! Think about it, paying somebody to count your taxes year after year, when you can save a fortune and do it yourself.  Above all, computers help you connect with old friends who have moved away or parted ways earlier in life. Now, the internet contains many social networking sites, such as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, where you can reunite with lost pals. These networks also offer access to photosharing and chat, so everybody can see how your family is and vice versa. Along with this is video chatting, where you can have face-to-face conversations with somebody even on the other side of the world. This is totally private, so it isn't dangerous to say names of family members or their locations. The internet truly is an amazing tool!  To conclude, the internet holds a very strong role in our daily lives. Not only can we see who won the latest sports game, but it also has interactive business software as well. Never again will work be so difficult. Also, the computer has programs to help you manage expenses, keeping you on top of your game. Finally, it is also helpful for all the tools that can be used to interact with friends thousands of miles away. I believe the computer is critical for success and happiness in life. It's a new age, let's adapt to it.

To whomever this may concern, imagine your life without a laptop or a desktop computer. It would be hectic, right? How would you keep up with your email or type up articles for this newspaper? Moreover, learning from websites can be far more engaging than traditional textbooks. Dear local newspaper,  Have you ever noticed how a lot of people are always on their laptops or computers? When people spend excessive time on the web, they often neglect physical exercise. This behavior can lead to negative consequences such as illness, memory loss, and a limited future.  Firstly, spending too much time on computers can result in health issues. Sedentary lifestyles coupled with continuous snacking while browsing the internet can contribute to obesity. People may search for quick fixes online, like surgeries, instead of opting for healthier alternatives such as regular exercise.  Furthermore, excessive screen time can impair memory and cognitive function. Individuals engrossed in their digital devices may forget important details, including personal relationships and daily tasks. This can lead to a disconnect from reality and a lack of engagement in the world around them.  Lastly, a future solely dependent on computer usage can be limiting. While some jobs can be done remotely through computers, these individuals may miss out on valuable experiences and opportunities that come with physical interaction and engagement. Dependency on technology can hinder personal growth and development.  In conclusion, it is crucial for individuals to strike a balance between screen time and physical activity to maintain good health, cognitive function, and a fulfilling future. By prioritizing exercise and reducing excessive computer usage, people can lead healthier and more enriching lives.  Sincerely, [Your Name]

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, I believe that more individuals should embrace the use of computers in their daily lives. Computers offer a plethora of benefits that traditional pen and paper methods cannot match. Firstly, computers provide a gateway to knowledge beyond what is taught in schools. They allow users to stay updated on current events, delve into the history of our nation, and gain insights into how our government functions. While some may argue that news can be obtained through newspapers or television, computers offer a more interactive and visually engaging experience, with the ability to present information in various formats.   Secondly, computers facilitate communication with friends and loved ones through online platforms. This is particularly valuable for maintaining relationships with individuals who may have moved away or attend different schools. For instance, I was able to reconnect with a friend who had relocated to Pittsburgh by using a social media platform. This digital communication tool enables us to bridge physical distances and stay connected regardless of our locations.  Lastly, computers serve as a centralized hub for storing important files, such as photos, videos, documents, and contacts. This organizational feature is beneficial for individuals like me, who struggle with keeping track of physical papers and materials. By utilizing a computer, I can easily access and share my work with others, whether it be emailing an assignment to a teacher or sharing notes with a friend who missed a day of school.  In conclusion, the versatility and convenience offered by computers make them essential tools for modern living. From expanding knowledge horizons to maintaining relationships and enhancing organization, computers have become indispensable in today's digital age. Therefore, I strongly advocate for more people to embrace the use of computers in their daily routines.

Dear @CAPS1 of the @ORGANIZATION1, it has come to my attention that many individuals are voicing concerns about the negative impacts of the technology boom and excessive computer usage. I firmly believe that technological advancements are doing more harm than good to our society. The prevalence of email and social media platforms has led to a decline in our interpersonal communication skills. People are spending less time engaging in physical activities outdoors, as they are increasingly glued to their screens, bombarded with inaccurate information. This overreliance on technology is detrimental to our well-being and overall development.  It is disheartening to see the younger generation growing up with poor communication skills, resorting to using slang and informal language even in formal settings. The erosion of proper grammar and language proficiency is a concerning trend that needs to be addressed. Instead of fostering meaningful connections and improving our communication abilities, technology is isolating us and diminishing our capacity to engage effectively with others.  Moreover, the sedentary lifestyle that often accompanies excessive computer usage contributes to the rising rates of obesity and other health issues. People are sacrificing physical activity and outdoor experiences for the sake of convenience and instant gratification provided by technology. This shift in priorities is alarming and has long-term consequences for our physical and mental well-being.  In addition, the abundance of unreliable information on the internet is leading people astray and hindering their ability to discern fact from fiction. The ease of access to information does not always equate to accuracy or credibility. Students, in particular, are falling prey to the allure of online resources without critically evaluating their validity. This reliance on unverified sources is detrimental to their academic performance and overall knowledge acquisition.  In conclusion, the detrimental effects of excessive computer usage and technology dependency are becoming increasingly evident in our society. It is imperative that we strike a balance between embracing technological advancements and preserving essential aspects of human interaction, physical activity, and critical thinking. Let us not lose sight of the beauty and benefits of nature, and prioritize our well-being over the allure of digital distractions.

Dear @ORGANIZATION1, I understand that experts are saying people are spending too much time on computers and I agree. Setting a limit on computer time, such as one hour, can help individuals prioritize other activities like exercise, which is essential for overall health.  Parents play a crucial role in influencing their children's behavior. By setting a good example and limiting their own computer usage, they can encourage their children to spend more time outdoors and engage in social activities rather than being glued to screens.  "Computer dead" refers to the state where individuals become overly reliant on computers, leading to withdrawal symptoms and a lack of balance in their lives. It's important to maintain a healthy relationship with technology to prevent it from taking over our lives completely.  In conclusion, managing our time effectively, promoting healthy computer usage habits, and avoiding becoming "computer dead" are essential for maintaining a balanced and fulfilling lifestyle. Thank you for considering my perspective on this matter.

Dear Local Newspaper, my opinion on the effects computers have on people is that I think the computer is good for people, not great but it's good for many reasons. For now, I have three reasons why it's good.   Firstly, computers allow people to search for new places and meet new people. With the help of search engines like Google, individuals can explore different locations and connect with others who share their interests. This opens up a world of possibilities and can lead to meaningful relationships that extend beyond the digital realm.  Secondly, computers provide entertainment for people when they have nothing to do. Whether it's watching movies online or playing games, computers offer a variety of options to keep individuals occupied and engaged. This can be a great way to unwind and relax without having to leave the comfort of one's home.  Lastly, teenagers, in particular, have become dependent on computers for various activities. From socializing with friends to completing school assignments, technology plays a crucial role in their daily lives. While it's important for young people to have a balance between screen time and other activities, the computer can be a valuable tool for learning and communication.  Overall, while there are some drawbacks to excessive computer use, I believe that the benefits outweigh the negatives. Computers have the potential to enrich people's lives in many ways and should be viewed as a valuable resource rather than a hindrance.

Computers have revolutionized society, particularly in the realm of social interaction. Through the internet, people can connect with individuals from all corners of the globe, fostering friendships and expanding their social circles. Platforms like Facebook, Myspace, and Twitter have become integral parts of daily life for many, with a significant percentage of the population maintaining accounts on these sites. Additionally, the advent of live video gaming has made gaming a more social experience, allowing players to engage with friends in real-time.  Moreover, computers can also enhance hand-eye coordination, a crucial skill used in various activities, including sports. By engaging in activities that require hand-eye coordination, such as playing video games or typing, individuals can improve their skills and dexterity. This improvement can have practical applications, such as increased speed in tasks like note-taking or copying information.  Furthermore, computers offer a wealth of educational opportunities through online learning. Whether researching destinations for vacations, studying historical figures, learning new recipes, or honing sports techniques, the internet provides a vast repository of information and resources. This accessibility to knowledge has empowered individuals to pursue their interests and expand their horizons in ways previously unimaginable.  In conclusion, computers have had a profound impact on society, facilitating social connections, enhancing skills like hand-eye coordination, and providing avenues for learning and personal growth. As technology continues to evolve, the benefits of computers in various aspects of life will only continue to expand, shaping the way we interact, learn, and thrive in the modern world.

Dear local newspapers,  People spending time on the computer is not a bad thing. In fact, it can be quite beneficial. Being on the computer can help improve hand-eye coordination, allow for learning about new and exciting topics, and facilitate communication with friends.   One important benefit of being on the computer is the improvement of hand-eye coordination. This skill can be crucial in various situations, such as in sports or even potentially life-threatening scenarios like the military. For instance, individuals with good hand-eye coordination, possibly developed through computer use, may be able to react quickly and effectively in dangerous situations, potentially saving lives.  Furthermore, the internet provides a vast amount of information that can be used for learning. By exploring different topics online, individuals can expand their knowledge and engage in conversations with others. This continuous learning process not only enhances one's understanding of the world but also boosts self-esteem and confidence.  Lastly, being on the computer allows individuals to communicate with friends and loved ones. This social interaction can have a positive impact on mental well-being and help individuals feel connected to others. Additionally, studies have shown that online communication can improve academic performance, as it encourages collaboration and sharing of ideas.  In conclusion, spending time on the computer can have numerous benefits, including improving hand-eye coordination, facilitating learning, and promoting social connections. Rather than being seen as a negative activity, being on the computer should be viewed as a valuable tool for personal growth and development.  Sincerely, [Your Name]

Imagine our beautiful town filled with unhealthy, lazy, noninteracting, and addicted people. The issue to grapple with is should you, the local people, spend more time on computers or not. I believe that we should not spend all of our time on computers. It can ruin your eyesight, you don't enjoy nature while interacting with people, and most importantly, it makes you very unhealthy. Can you picture a person in your town blind and having glasses or even going to the eye doctor? Just ask eye doctors, "Every year I get more and more people coming to the eye doctors. You might say that it is good for me, but it is not good for you. When you are always on the computer, it erodes your eyesight over time." Indeed, many people wear glasses now more than ever. It went up almost 10% from last year and 15% from the year before. Almost everyone that has a computer and is addicted to it has glasses.  Have you looked outside lately? Have you noticed that spring is coming and there are leaves on the trees now? If you were one of the people glued to the monitor of your computer, then I doubt you were. In that time, you could be spending time with your precious little girl or even your best friend outside in nature having fun. I remember a time when I wanted to play catch with my dad, but he was on his old computer. I didn't want to play alone, so I just stayed inside and went on my computer for the day. Do you want that to happen to every person every day? I wouldn't.  Yes, people would rather be couch potatoes and chat online, eating bags of unhealthy chips instead of going out and interacting while staying fit, but now it is important that you do. Just picture lazy, obese people sitting on their couch all day with their eyes bloodshot from staring at the monitor for hours. But why do you then you ask? It is because they never come outside. They never go for a jog or eat healthy foods. That is very unhealthy and can increase your chances of getting different cancers. Just ask the hospital staff, "Last year, one guy was rushed to the hospital because of a very common cancer that you get from unhealthy living, he passed away two days later. It was very sad."  I strongly believe that being on the computer for too long is a very bad idea. It can ruin your eyesight, you never get to see nature and interact. But most importantly, it is very unhealthy. In conclusion, while there are valid concerns about the impact of technology on society, it is essential to recognize the numerous benefits and opportunities that advancements bring. Embracing technology can lead to personal growth, economic prosperity, and enhanced enjoyment of life.

Dear @PERSON2, Have you ever noticed how different our society is today, even from just ten years ago? That's because of computers. Yes, it is true that computers give us advantages like messaging and information, but they also take away from some of the greater aspects of life: staying fit, enjoying nature, and spending time with family and friends. Without those, life would be horribly unbeneficial. While surfing the web may be fun, it has been proven unhealthy. "If a person was to spend more than two and a half hours on the computer every day for about a month they would see a sudden increase in their weight. And if they kept the behavior up, they could gain up to one third of their initial body weight until medical help was provided," say specialists in obesity. Also, a significant percentage of all computer users snack while online, which only increases weight gain even more. Unfortunately, those that spend a lot of time on the computer are not usually okay with exercising either. Instead of putting down just a half an hour out of their computer time to play with the dog, take a jog, or try some aerobics, computer lovers usually just stay in front of the screen. That's too bad because it causes health problems for them and maybe even the generations after them. Nature is being ignored more than ever. Trails and forests are becoming emptier as more people opt to stay indoors with their computers. The beauty of nature is being almost completely passed by due to today's new technologies, especially computers. Some worry if it will fade entirely, and instead of trying to maintain what's left, we may just let it go. Doctors and people alike are seeing more and more how computers affect family life. Family interactions are decreasing as individuals become more engrossed in their screens. Setting a little time aside daily to observe the aspects of life outside of computers can help ensure that life with computers will be beneficial after all. Let's make an effort to balance our digital lives with real-world experiences to maintain a healthy lifestyle and connections with nature and loved ones.

Computers have become an integral part of our daily lives, especially for children who use them for learning and entertainment. While computers offer many benefits such as access to vast amounts of information and educational resources, there are also drawbacks that need to be considered.  One major concern is the amount of time children spend on computers, which can lead to a sedentary lifestyle and lack of physical activity. This can result in health issues such as obesity and a lack of interest in outdoor activities. Additionally, children may become addicted to computer games, prioritizing them over schoolwork and other important tasks.  Another issue with computers is the potential for online predators to target children. It is easy for individuals to create fake identities and deceive children into revealing personal information. This poses a significant risk to their safety and privacy.  Moreover, computers are susceptible to viruses and technical problems that can result in the loss of important files and data. This can be frustrating and time-consuming, affecting productivity and causing inconvenience to users.  In conclusion, while computers offer valuable learning opportunities and access to information, it is important to be mindful of the negative impact they can have on children. It is essential for parents and educators to monitor and regulate children's computer usage to ensure a balanced and healthy lifestyle.

Dear local newspaper, it has come to my attention that there is a debate surrounding the impact of computers on society. While some argue that computers have a positive effect on people, I believe that the excessive use of computers is becoming a concerning issue. Many individuals are spending an excessive amount of time on computers, often just playing games and engaging in unproductive activities.   Although computers can be a useful tool for tasks such as paying bills and staying connected with others, the misuse of technology is evident. People are taking advantage of the anonymity provided by computers to engage in negative behaviors, such as cyberbullying and online threats. This misuse of technology can lead to harmful consequences, including conflicts and potential dangers.  Furthermore, the internet poses various risks, especially for teenagers. Social media platforms like MySpace and Twitter can expose individuals to predators who may pose as someone they are not. This can lead to dangerous situations where individuals are lured into meeting strangers in person. Additionally, the prevalence of hacking presents a significant threat to personal privacy. Hackers can gain access to webcams and private information, putting individuals at risk of invasion of privacy and identity theft.  In conclusion, while computers offer numerous benefits, the negative effects of excessive computer usage and online dangers cannot be overlooked. It is essential for individuals to use technology responsibly and be aware of the potential risks associated with it. Measures must be taken to address these issues and ensure the safe and responsible use of computers in society.

Dear Newspaper, I believe that computers have both positive and negative effects on people. However, I believe that there are more positive effects than negative. Some of these positive effects include the essential role they play in education, their ability to facilitate communication, and the fun activities they offer.  One major advantage of computers is their educational value. They provide access to a vast amount of information, making research easier and more efficient. Additionally, computers allow students to type their papers, ensuring legibility and neatness. Furthermore, individuals can work from home when sick or on vacation, thanks to the convenience of emailing documents to colleagues or teachers.  Communication is another significant benefit of computers. They offer various channels for staying connected, such as email, social media platforms like Facebook and Twitter, and video chatting services like Skype. These tools make it easy to communicate with others regardless of distance, enhancing social interactions and relationships.  Moreover, computers provide entertainment and leisure options. Users can purchase or download games, both for leisure and educational purposes. Additionally, free online games are readily available, offering a quick and enjoyable way to pass the time. While excessive gaming can be addictive, moderation can make it a harmless and fun activity.  In conclusion, despite some negative aspects, computers offer numerous positive effects on individuals. They serve as valuable educational tools, enhance communication capabilities, and provide entertainment options. Embracing the positive aspects of computers can lead to a more productive and enjoyable experience with technology.
